form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Cardin (for himself and Mr. Boozman) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources

form.official-title: To authorize a Wall of Remembrance as part of the Korean War Veterans Memorial and to allow certain private contributions to fund the Wall of Remembrance.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Korean War Veterans Memorial Wall of Remembrance Act of 2015.
Public Law 99–572 (40 U.S.C. 8903 note; 100 Stat. 3226) is amended by adding at the end the following:

subsection.text: The memorial authorized under section 1 shall include a Wall of Remembrance.
Federal funds may not be used to construct the Wall of Remembrance.
The American Battle Monuments Commission shall request and consider design recommendations from the Korean War Veterans Memorial Foundation, Inc., for the establishment of the Wall of Remembrance.
The Wall of Remembrance shall include—

paragraph.text: a list by name of members of the Armed Forces of the United States who died in theater in the Korean War;
the number of members of the Armed Forces of the United States who, in regards to the Korean War—

subparagraph.text: are listed as missing in action; or

paragraph.text: the number of members of the Korean Augmentation to the United States Army, the Republic of Korea Armed Forces, and the other nations of the United Nations Command who, in regards to the Korean War—

subparagraph.text: are listed as missing in action; or
